column4: i'm trying to configure squid.conf. but must use the root account
how do i go to root account in ubuntu?
how to go to root in ubuntu????
if i use vi command, and want to insert on the conf file, i just type "i" right?
right, the 'i' command puts you in insert mode in vi.
hit ESC, then type ":wq <enter>" to save your changes and quit
but, it still can't be inserted. on the file property root user have access to read n write
and how to i exit the root user? i type exit and close the terminal, but when i open it again and type sudo su, it doesn't ask for password anymore
'sudo' remembers your password for several minutes...that's working as expected.
can i change the time interval to 0?
so it don't remember the password as i type exit?

You can change how long the 'sudo' command with cache your credentials by setting the 'timestamp_timeout' paramets in the Defaults section of /etc/sudoers (google it for more info)...but most people just leave the default.
